title: Doomsday
description: Dwight installs a "Doomsday Device" on the office computers that could get everyone fired if they make too many mistakes, while Gabe tries to hit on one of Darryl's warehouse employees.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Flickering Lights] Hey everybody it's closing time. You don't got to go home but you can't stay here. [Plays radio and the song is Closing Time by Semisonic]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [Laughs and shrieks]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Closing time.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Every office needs an end of the day tradition. Something to tell you the day is over.  Otherwise, you go home and the night just feels like more day.  It's weird.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Closing time

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [On phone] ...W R K.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: One last call for alcohol so finish your whiskey and beer.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh no it's W R K, as in kitten.  Oh my boss is singing Closing Time, maybe that's what you are hearing.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Come on pam!

quotes.speaker: {Andy}/{Pam}
quotes.text: [Singing, Pam mumbling lyrics] Closing time, time for you to go home to the places you will be from.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Let's see. Andy has been manager for a hundred and five days. Which means I've heard 'Closing Time' a hundred and five times. [nods and shakes head] Still don't know the words. Tah wa Ta way hm hm home and home and home.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I know who I want to take me home. I know who I want to take me home. [Pulls towel through legs] I know who I want to take me home. [Spins Meredith in chair] Take me hooo...hooome! You know what fine! I try to start fun traditions for you guys, but if you don't want to sing... no traditions!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [singing] Closing time every new beginning...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I've never heard that song before. And once I heard it, I did not care for it, but that song means it's time to go home. Now...it's my favorite song.

quotes.speaker: {Andy}/{Stanley}
quotes.text: [singing] Every new beginning comes from some other beginnings end.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Goodnight.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whose your favorite iron chef?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: [speaking at the same time as andy] This is atrocious.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You go first.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: The ticketing software paints a picture of a sloppy, careless, error prone office.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well the monitoring software is a double edged sword. Sometimes...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [runs in and interrupts] Sorry, go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: [to dwight] Did you need something from us?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wha...Yes. Your attention. Uh because... No that is all. [walks out]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Last night I dreamed that the number two was the most valued number in the world. The vice president had all the power. Athletes fought for silver medals. Women were considered the best gender. And stadiums of fans shouted "We're number two!'. As with all my dreams, I'm guessing it was about my fear of immigrants.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Last week an accounting mistake resulted in a client getting their order for free.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Umpf...that's not good. Chalk that one up to Tweedle Dee and Tweedle Dumb out there.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Who are they?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: They're both Kevin. Oscar is the Sex and the City gang and Angela, if you can picture...

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Andrew sometimes I feel like you don't know me at all.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I would agree with that.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Simply...end the mistakes

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: End the mistakes, easy-

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: When I come back next week and this report shows me no mistakes, we can talk about names, all day. Our favorite names, silly made up names, normal names said in a silly voice. Wouldn't that be nice?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I would like that.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: End the mistakes. That is all I ask. [gets up from chair] And you can't have a favorite Iron Chef. It depends entirely on the secret ingredient. Sometimes I feel you don't know food at all.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm just saying with the NBA lockout I think roller derby's in a really good place now. So...my pitch is...me, Pam, you and, someone else maybe Justine.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Nahh! [shakes head] No. Not Justine. Never Justine.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is that off again?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Hey, mandatory warehouse safety meeting. Today.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Ahh...We don't really do those. We just sign the thing.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Are you really this lazy?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'll be there.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Monday's suck.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Yeaha...yup. [awkward silence then points to door] Just trying to get in.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I may have a little solution to our mistakes problem. This is a project I've been working on for quite some time and today, might be the day to use it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What do you got?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [opens folder] Allow me. You're going to love this. [struggles opening folder] Ugh...should've used a shorter string. Never mind, I know it by heart. It is a system that holds people accountable for everyone else's work.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sounds controversial.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Have I not been worthy of your trust? Have I not been a reliable number two?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Do not go there! You're the deuce I never want to drop.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, I can make this work. I'll set it up right now. Just need your go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Go do the voodoo that you do so well.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I will do my voodoo.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mmhmmm.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Hey. I need you to get the paperwork rolling on a new workplace relationship.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: For you?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Yes. For Gabe.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Who are you seeing? That's gr...

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Whom I'm seeing is Val from down in the warehouse.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I'm not technically seeing her, but uh I've seen her, with the eyes and uh there was attraction. In at least one direction. So..[holds up fist]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You know I don't have to do the paperwork unless you're actually dating.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Ok, but once this starts, it's going to be moving fast. It's going to be hot and heavy and I don't want a bunch of bureaucratic red tape wrapped around my jock. You know?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: But I mean...uh have you talked to her? Is sh...

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Yeah we had a whole conversation about Mondays...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Do you know her last name, yet?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Toby I'm going to tell you her last name tomorrow because she's going to be screaming it tonight.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: She's going to be screaming her own last name?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Hey! Watch it.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Good luck Gabe.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hi guys. I just wanted to say that, you all have been doing amazing work., really.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And I'd like to add that your work has been a little sloppy. So, Dwight and I have implemented a new program that we like to call...Dwight...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The accountability booster. It registers every time a mistake has been made in the office. From a late delivery to an accounting error. Five strikes in a day equals a home run. One home run and you're out.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: If we as a group make five mistakes in a day, something bad happens like we block Minesweeper.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Or in this case an email gets sent to Robert California containing the consultants report from last year. Remember the one that recommended the branch be shutdown? And as a fail-safe also every negative email you've ever written about him to the group will also be forwarded to him.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What emails are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Robert's favorite songs: Creep by TLC, Creep by Radio Head. You remember that one Jim? There is no way he hasn't strangled at least one stripper. Oscar. He eats his yogurt like he is punishing it for disappointing him. Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: That's not that bad actually.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: P.S. We should should kill him.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait, so you installed a doomsday device?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, it's an accountability booster.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Which when it goes off it destroys everything. Very similar to a doomsday device.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim, you're trying to make me sound like some kind of evil maniac. Now the point is that we are now working in an environment where we have accountability to each other. I am confident that you guys are equal to the task.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Um, no we're not and you are a psycho who is ruining our lives.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: We can't do this Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Everyone angrily disagreeing]Smile...nod. Smile and nod.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: They are making me out to be a Bond villian. I like to think of myself as a brilliant scientist who will stop at nothing to remake the world. Like...not Doctor Moreau someone good. Doctor Frankenstein, Doctor Jekyll, not them. Doctor...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Are you sure this is a good idea? I mean the thing about this office is, we make a lot of mistakes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But the device will change that. Without a safety net, people will improve.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright everybody, looks like we need to be getting to work. Be extra careful. Double check everything or the accountability booster will getcha.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: This doomsdays device sounds like a scare tactic to me.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: There's an easy way to tell if this device is a sham. We just make a mistake. I'll send an order down to shipping before we've received payment.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [alert goes off] Oh, there's one mistake.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Now we only have four strikes left until a home run.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dwight's our co-worker and he worked really hard on this doomsday device so I...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's not a doomsday device, gosh. [Erin makes red strike on desk] We can do this you guys.

quotes.speaker: Warehouse Crew
quotes.text: First. Second.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It's not a race.

quotes.speaker: Warehouse Crew
quotes.text: Thirrrr....third.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Who knows what the belt is for?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: It's for protecting my ass. When you suckers lift more than you can handle. Sup, I'm Gabe. Corporate. Continue. Don't be nervous.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Apparently we have a visitor. Gabe, everyone.

quotes.speaker: Warehouse Crew
quotes.text: Hi, gabe.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: All right so the support belt. Now this one is mine. Doesn't get much use nowadays.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Look at this, this is enormous.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I get the sense that Val enjoys a good putdown. Considering that's the only thing I know about her. I will be milking that hard. [Gestures milking a cow]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: It's like a hula hoop. Right. Mele Kalikimaka is the wise way.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You done?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: The Michelin man called, he wants his cummerbund back.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Remember we have to give Rigo Escrow their refund by five.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I'm on it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Kevin, maybe I should handle that. We really need you to focus on your project.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Good thinking.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Apparently a big client for this company, needs to know the story of how paper gets made.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oscar, use a calculator. [Oscar shakes head]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: When the stakes are this high, there is only one computer that I trust. And it's powered by thai food and spanish reds. [points to his head]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright everybody, you are doing great!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, I wouldn't say that. Three mistakes already is pretty terrible, but I do see improvement. Meredith kept someone on hold for thirty minutes and now look she's hard at work. [Meredith gives dwight the finger]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, question.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No questions.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: If this doomsday device goes off...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Accountability booster.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: If this bad idea goes off and we all lose our jobs. Are you going to feel good about that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I haven't even considered it. That's how sure I am that this accountability booster is going to work.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Try mose1234.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Dwight would never be that obvious. Try something like...z64$8. [incorrect password] Not that exactly Jim, something like that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How about Scrantonstrangler666.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. Oh shoot. Ha ha ha...You guys are never gonna shut down the machine, ok? But I appreciate your energy and your team work. If you applied this to your regular work, You won't even notice that the device is there, watching you ready to strike.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Wha...what's Dwight's mothers name.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hmm...Heda. [alert] No.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Once you read the packet, sign the back.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Hey Darryl, I was thinking, uh, maybe while we read through this, uh, you could grab us all some coffee. My treat. It's a hundred dollar bill. Should cover it I think. Don't bring me any of that caramel soy latte crap, ok? I want a decaf frappuccino. Val...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Actually, Val, why don't you come with? I'll need the extra hands to carry them back.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Yeah, sure.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Uh.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mmhmm. [points at gabe] Caramel soy latte.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Decaf frap-

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Got it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You sent the late notice to Ryan Heart & Wolf. Right?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Mhm. Six-forty, six-twenty.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Six-seventy, six-twenty.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Nuh uh.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: yes!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Five eighty-eight plus fifteen percent- Oh no.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What does this mean? What does it mean!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Andy. [alert sounds]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Ohhhh!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Gahhh. That's five strikes.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [pulls out Brandy bottle] Well...I was saving this for my retirement, which I guess is today.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dwight we got five strikes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Did the email go out or...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It goes out automatically at five P.M.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, th- There's gotta be a way to stop it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, I would have to enter my password in order to cancel it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ok! Dwight you may now enter your password.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You don't deserve to have this branch. Five mistakes in less than a day.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: We did our best.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No you didn't, Phyllis. You complained the whole time. You yelled at me. You tried to break into the machine. [everyone interjects] What?!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You're a real crumb bum, you know that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, you can't just change the rules because you don't like the outcome. What about you, Kevin? What about you and your fake task? Can you tell me now where paper comes from?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Uh, the man tree puts its penis-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ha. Ok, alright. Andy back me up here, please.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Nn no.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Dwight be human for once. Shut down the machine.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Shut it down! Shut it down! Shut down the machine!!! [erin joins in yelling] Shut it down! Shut it down!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good luck finding a new job idiots. I'll make sure to write you a glowing reference. Glowingly negative.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Dwight's car is gone.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I bet he went home.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Some of us should go there and talk some sense into him. Get him to stop that email.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Pam, you should come with me. Dwight really likes you and your breasts are enormous that could help us.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Kevin has that lovability.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Guys come on. I'm right here.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Jim, I want you to go find Robert just be where he is in case that email goes out at five. You can try to delete it or something.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, where is he?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Uh, he's at some club where you either eat squash or play squash.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'll try both.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [digging] Oh. Come to reason with me?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Gotcha something. [gives Dwight cap, Dwight throws it aside] And, uh, I just really want to talk to you-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Get lost.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well now hold on it, it-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What does it look like I'm doing? Digging a grave for a horse.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uhm.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Do you need a hand?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, do you need a hand? [everyone joins in]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If you hit another horse, you've dug to far.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I'll see you next week Will. [at the club, playing squash]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Robert.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Jim what are you...What a surprise.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, well, you know just had a meeting. Squash meeting.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You up for a game?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: A game or a match?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Exactly. Here we go. Let's do it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you okay, Kevin? [Kevin gives thumbs down]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [to Dwight] Where you going?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: In. I'm hungry.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, could we come in too? Just for some water.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. Take off your shoes. Except you Kevin, they stay on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, wow. I forgot how pretty your house is.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is the new addition, built my Erasmus Schrute in 1808. It doubled as a tuberculosis recovery room until 2009.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: That's too much Doodle and not enough Lab.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, when are they gonna do a Labradoodle that's just Lab?

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: That's what I'm sayin'.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: [to Val] Hey. You're welcome.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Thanks for the coffee.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: So, tonight I was thinking, I'm gonna go to the cemetery. I'm gonna drink a little wine and I thought maybe you'd like to come with me.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Are you asking me on a date?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Yes, I am.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Because I don't date coworkers. It's not personal, it's a matter of policy.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I could quit. Problem solved.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Don't quit. [Darryl eavesdropping, nods]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Good policy. Sensible. Smart.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright. Serving. Serving. Serving. Serving.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: In the box.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: In the box. [hits it straight into the floor]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why haven't we heard anything? It's 4:45. There's only 15 minutes left.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh, now you can do math? Where were you 2 hours ago 'A Beautiful Mind'-

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I made a mistake. I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I know how to save the company, everyone. Just write a petition, get everyones' signature, including our clients, march down to Florida, and shove it up your butt! Ha! [laughing and drinking Brandy]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's not that funny.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [Kevin comes around corner with a pan, ready to strike Dwight, Pam shakes her head] Oh, Pam. You got something on your shirt.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, haha. Oh well. Pobody's nerfect, right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Did you just have a stroke, Pam? It's "Nobody's perfect." Nice stroke, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No. It's a jokey saying. Pobody's nerfect, like I can't even say those words right. Ha.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I hadn't heard that before, that's, that's funny.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dwight, there's just a small matter of a-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know what would go so great with this cabbage pie? Milk.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Any specific animal?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm thinking cow-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don't say cow- Ugh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What are you doing? It's 5 to 5.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Just don't talk about the email, okay? He's gonna cancel it on his own, I really think he will.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's insane!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Just trust me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Trust you, like I trusted Dwight this morning.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I got this.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Enngh-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hahhh, thanks for everything.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sive drafely. [Pam points back at him, smiling]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Isn't it supposed to be, "Drive safely"?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [a text tone goes off] Is that my phone?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Sounded like mine.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nah, I think it's mine. Lemme just check real quick, here. Alright.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Well, it's mine. You took it out of my bag.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, oh yeah.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Can I have it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes. Right now? Yes.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Here you go. [throws it over glass]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Whoa, no, wait, wait, wait, whoa. [tries to catch it with racket, misses, lands on floor]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: [censored beep] ha, Jesus.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Awww, sorry. Did it break?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Nah, it's good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You sure?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What kinda iPhone is that?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: It's the standard one. The one everyone has.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh yeah. I have the one that nobody has. Is there anything interesting?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: It depends Jim. Do you find one-day only Jet Blue sales to Buffalo interesting?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ha ha. No, I don't. No, I don't. Alright, well, I am sore and obviously horrible at this, so- [texting on his phone]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: My serve!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [her text tones rings] Dwight stopped the device!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Haho!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [his phone vibrates] He stopped it!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh! [everyone yelling out, celebrating] We still have our jobs.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: They're not my favorite people in the world. I wouldn't even call them friends. They come over here, eat my pie, dig the crappiest horse grave you've ever seen. [pulls cap he previously discarded, out of the dirt] God, I'm gonna have to work with them forever, aren't I?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Take it easy. Nice and easy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [hits ball, ricochets to groin] Ah! Classic, right? [Jim continues to rally poorly and falls down]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Oo!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm alright.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: You alright?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Skinned knee.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep. Ah. Oh. [and skinned elbow]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Oo, a little ice on that maybe.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. That does not feel good.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Okay. My serve.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Let's not make any mistakes today. Or at least no more than four.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: This doomsday device sounds like a scare tactic to me. Y2K all over again.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Oh, I was all about the Y2K bug. Paid some guy to update my PC, threw out my microwave, canceled my plane ticket, sold all my stocks, spent New Year's Eve with a gas mask on my face. I was even wearing a diaper! Someone said Y2K would get the toilets.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This could be real. Dwight's pretty handy with computers. He fixed my laptop once.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, he didn't fix it. The brightness level was all the way down.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You couldn't fix it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I wasn't here that day.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes you were.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No- Ok. Well, we'll talk about it later. Straussburg! I had a meeting in Straussburg and I dropped you off beforehand. I was wearing a tan shirt with stripes?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't think so, babe.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, this is crazy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I have never played squash. But I have seen it in countless 80's movies and it seems like the most common mistake is that you serve too hard and hit yourself right in the squash balls. So, as long as I don't do that, I think I'll be alright.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Eleven love. I win again.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [grunts] Good game. You are a worthy opponent. You wanna play one more?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I don't think so.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No? Come on.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Why? Not only are you terrible at squash, but you don't even seem to enjoy it. Jim, this is not enough of a challenge for me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, that is... because you didn't realize that... I was left-handed.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What are you doing here, Gabe?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Well Darryl, considering that I basically own the place, I'm just chillin' at mi casa. This is me, in repose..I suppose.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: You know, there's this expression: Bro's before Ho's. And what that's short for is brothers before whores. Uh, I don't buy that. I would throw any brother under the bus for any whore. Woman.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Robert, do you wanna smoke pipes during our meeting?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Let's wait, until we have something to smoke about.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes. Of course. [whispers] Erin..[throws pipes at Erin]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Maybe I could sit in on this one with you? You know, that way I can cover you in case you need to urinate or you just want another opinion, or defecate...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't think so.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well I just thought with my new increased responsibilities and all...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. I'm still figuring out the two man bobsled here, so let's hold off on the D-man for now.
